channel.title: Guy Shoots Air Rifle Into Friend's Ass, Intestines Explode
channel.description:
A German steel foundry worker has been given a nine months jail sentence after poking an air rifle up his friend's bottom and firing it - causing his intestines to explode. Denis Schwarz, 25, said he'd only wanted to help his pal who had complained about sweaty buttocks from working in the Halberg Guss factory where molten metal kept temperatures soaring. He said he had jokingly offered to help his friend cool down by blowing some air over him and said: "We often played around with air rifles - it was just a bit of fooling around - I said I was going to shoot him in the bum. He said he didn't care and I pulled the trigger and he just collapsed." The Court in Leipzig, which gave him a suspended sentence, heard that the high pressure air blast had ruptured the man's intestines and he had almost died. His victim said: "I suddenly felt this incredible pain - you can't imagine it. I couldn't breathe it hurt so much, you can't know how happy I was when I got to hospital and they gave me an anaesthetic." Prosecutors told the court: "The blast of air burst his intestines causing massive internal bleeding. It was an emergency operation which the victim almost died from. He was in intensive care for 11 days. A big section of his large intestine was removed and he had to have a bag fitted to collect waste."
sauce: http://austriantimes.at/index.php?id=11098 Hmm.. well that's interesting.

item.title: Guy Shoots Air Rifle Into Friend's Ass, Intestines Explode
item.dc:creator: @phonnygoblin phonnygoblin
item.description:
@phonnygoblin wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:14, topic:262883”][quote author=ThAt0n36Uy link=topic=347152.msg2674171#msg2674171 date=1234976216]
It shouldn’t be assault. I mean Sexual Assault is, a statutory offense that provides that it is a crime to knowingly cause another person to engage in an unwanted sexual act by force or threat. The other man gave consent to it, so legally it shouldn’t be a crime.
[/quote]

I meant assault as in beating someone up. That’s called assault too, right? I mean, if I tell you to beat me to soup and you do it, you’ll get punished anyway.[/quote]

It’s not assault dipshit.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 25, 2009, 02:00:20 am[/size][hr]Edit:

Here are my sources ass bags:
Arkansas Code, Title 5, Chapter 13, Subchapter 2, § 205-207
California Penal Code, Part 1, Chapter 9, § 240

Unless you’re not part of the U.S. I’m pretty sure the actual crime was assault, but if the hypothetical situation given was played out in the US, it would definitely not be assault.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 25, 2009, 02:02:49 am[/size][hr][quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:29, topic:262883”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=347152.msg2676621#msg2676621 date=1235100694]

He’s an Aussie and it was a shame he didn’t die in those wildfires LOL!

That’s a pretty distasteful thing to say, especially when Americans lost loved ones in the 2001 terrorist attacks and Australians were sympathetic towards your plight. To genuinely wish something like that upon someone is disgusting.

I suppose it’s a good thing that there are decent Americans on this forum, otherwise I’d be left with a pretty dim view of your country.
[/quote]

AMERICA IS BETTER THAN ALL OTHER COUNTRIES. Earth is flat, america is center of universe, God bless america, guns, boobs, beer. America isn’t obese, everyone else is just too skinny.[/quote]

The fires, many of which seem to have been started intentionally are in no way funny.

Read full topic

why is he getting charged if his friend said it was ok?

There was a German cannibal who had permission to eat someone (from the person he ate), but do you think he shouldn’t be punished?
[/quote]
How do they cops know he had permission?[/quote]

The cannibal posted on a forum, asking for a man that he could eat. And some dude responded. It was pretty gay actually. I mean, cannibalism is one thing, but they ate his dick together before killing him. I mean, gay cannibal?

[quote=“Not X A Alex, post:9, topic:262883”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=347152.msg2674077#msg2674077 date=1234970843]

why is he getting charged if his friend said it was ok?

There was a German cannibal who had permission to eat someone (from the person he ate), but do you think he shouldn’t be punished?
[/quote]
well eating someone is illegal but shooting air up a bum isnt[/quote]
